document.docAuthor: Pacheco-Chaves, Bernald, Cordeiro, Isabelle Da Rocha Silva, Moreira, Felipe Ferraz Figueiredo & Springer, Monika
document.masterDocTitle: The water striders (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Gerridae) of Costa Rica: new species, checklist, and new records

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The water striders (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Gerridae) of Costa Rica: new species, checklist, and new records

subSubSection.paragraph:
Trepobates trepidus
is another widespread species, although less than
T. taylori
, occurring from the southern United States to Ecuador ( Drake & Harris 1928a , b , 1933 ; Beck 1936 ; Drake & Harris 1938 ; Drake & Hottes 1951a , 1952 ; Drake & Chapman 1953 ; Drake & Roze 1954 ; Matsuda 1962 ; Alvarez & Roldán 1983 ; Aristizábal 2002 ; Polhemus & Polhemus 2002 ; Padilla-Gil & Nieser 2003 ; Camacho & Molano 2005; Molano et al. 2005, 2008; Molano & Camacho 2006 ; Rivera & Camacho 2006 ; Valencia 2006 ;
Rivera et al. 2008
; Morales & Molano 2008 ; Posso & González 2008 ;
Galindo et al. 2009
; Morales & Castro 2010 ; Buzzetti & Cianferoni 2011 ; Padilla- Gil 2012; Mondragón & Morales 2013 ; Herrera 2014). It was previously reported from Costa Rica ( Puntarenas and San José provinces) and is herein recorded for the first time from Alajuela , Cartago , Guanacaste , and Limón provinces. The habitats occupied are the same as those of
T. taylori
, in both slopes of Costa Rica up to 700 m a.s.l.

Material examined . Alajuela— Chachagua, N 10° 24’ 29.1’’, W -084° 34’ 13.0’’, 136 m a.s.l., 2008, (B. Pacheco): 1 male, 7 females, 5 nymphs (MZUCR). San Carlos, Chachagua,
